radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: CT scan of abdomen and pelvis
radiographic_examinations.findings: Distended tip of appendix up to 12mm without fat stranding, distended gallbladder containing multiple stones with subtle fat stranding. Findings quoted as 'very limited' given body habitus.
GB wall thickening to 4.2mm, multiple gallstones, CBD 4mm.

Port-A-Cath tip residing in the low SVC or cavoatrial junction. Lung volumes are markedly low, with no overt evidence for pneumonia, CHF, large effusion or pneumothorax. Basilar atelectasis likely present.
